BackCBSeatShrug.name: Cambered Barbell Seated Shrug
BackCBSeatShrug.preparation: Sit on end of bench and grasp cambered bar from beneath with overhand or mixed grip.
BackCBSeatShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackCBSeatShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackBBShrug.name: Barbell Shrug
BackBBShrug.preparation: Stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip shoulder width or slightly wider.
BackBBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackBBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackTBShrug.name: Trap Bar Shrug
BackTBShrug.preparation: Step into trap barbell and stand holding handles of trap bar to sides.
BackTBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackTBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackSBShrugStand.name: Trap Bar Shrug (elevated stand)
BackSBShrugStand.preparation: Step into elevated trap bar stand. Bend down and grasp handles of apparatus to sides. Stand upright.
BackSBShrugStand.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackSBShrugStand.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.
